note: Guidelines for generating essays that match each student's writing style

run_on_sentences.notes: Careful sentences, but may have occasional run-ons when nervous

word_count.notes: Thoughtful and careful, tends to be slightly above average length

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary but uses it carefully and thoughtfully, doesn't show off. Strong in English but shy personality means she doesn't flaunt her knowledge.
Average vocabulary, uses words naturally without trying to show off. Weak in English grammar means he doesn't overthink word choice.

run_on_sentences.notes: May drift into run-ons when easily distracted or losing topic

word_count.notes: Flowery descriptions and cosmic metaphors add length

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary and uses it naturally in flowery descriptions. Artistic and dreamy personality means she naturally gravitates toward descriptive, poetic words.

run_on_sentences.notes: Lab-report style writing is structured and avoids run-ons

word_count.notes: Analytical and literal-minded, stays close to average

vocabulary.notes: Knows technical/analytical vocabulary well but weak in creative writing. May misuse descriptive or creative words when trying to be expressive (e.g., using 'utilize' when 'use' is better, or misusing creative adjectives).

run_on_sentences.notes: Explicitly has 'run-on sentences' in writing quirks, dramatic and extroverted

word_count.notes: Dramatic and extroverted, tends to write longer with exaggerated statements

vocabulary.notes: Tries to use big words to show off (dramatic, extroverted personality). May misuse words occasionally (1-2 per essay) - uses words that sound impressive but aren't quite right for the context.

word_count.notes: Reflective with strong sensory details, slightly above average

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary but uses it carefully and thoughtfully. Quiet, empathetic personality means he doesn't show off but naturally uses appropriate descriptive words for sensory details.

word_count.notes: Competitive and confident, tends to be direct and concise

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary and isn't afraid to use it, but weak in spelling means she may misspell bigger words (1-2 per essay). Confident enough to try words but spelling weakness shows through.

run_on_sentences.notes: Messy structure, high-energy class clown - rushes and creates run-ons

word_count.notes: Messy structure means wide variation, but averages around target

vocabulary.notes: Average vocabulary, uses casual language. Class clown, high-energy personality means he doesn't try to show off with big words - keeps it simple and conversational.

run_on_sentences.notes: Very organized structure, perfectionist - avoids run-ons

word_count.notes: Perfectionist and organized, stays close to average

vocabulary.notes: Knows extensive vocabulary (studious, perfectionist) but deliberately uses 'safe vocabulary' to avoid mistakes. Anxious personality means she prefers simpler, safer words she's certain about rather than risking errors with advanced vocabulary.

run_on_sentences.notes: Uses short sentence fragments for effect - avoids run-ons

word_count.notes: Edgy tone with dramatic contrasts, tends to be concise

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary and uses it effectively. Rebellious, clever personality means he chooses words carefully for dramatic effect and edgy tone. May use some unusual or edgy word choices.

run_on_sentences.notes: Bubbly and optimistic, but maintains sentence structure

word_count.notes: Cheerful phrasing and sentimental conclusions add length

vocabulary.notes: Average vocabulary, uses simple, cheerful words. Bubbly, optimistic personality means she prefers accessible, positive language over complex vocabulary.

run_on_sentences.notes: Rigid structure, formal writing - avoids run-ons

word_count.notes: Tiny-professor tone with definitions, slightly above average

vocabulary.notes: Knows extensive vocabulary and shows it off. Old-soul, formal personality means he uses advanced, formal words and defines terms before using them. Loves demonstrating his vocabulary knowledge.

run_on_sentences.notes: Long winding sentences and overexplains - can become run-ons

word_count.notes: Overexplains concepts and adds factual asides, tends to be longer

vocabulary.notes: Knows extensive vocabulary, especially technical/scientific terms. Curious, overcommitted personality means she naturally uses advanced vocabulary when overexplaining concepts. Uses technical words correctly.

word_count.notes: Elaborate analogies and fantasy metaphors add length

vocabulary.notes: Knows good vocabulary and uses it in elaborate analogies. Anxious, self-critical personality means he thinks carefully about word choice for his fantasy metaphors and elaborate comparisons.

run_on_sentences.notes: Highly structured paragraphs, organized - avoids run-ons

word_count.notes: Organized and dependable, stays close to average

vocabulary.notes: Average vocabulary, uses words correctly but not showy. Organized, dependable personality means she uses appropriate vocabulary without trying to impress or show off.

run_on_sentence_types: Stream-of-consciousness style when distracted or rushed
